body: I believe multiple methods are necessary for readability. Only the last rule has to cover everything, and then it might as well be the JNI rules. For JNI methods in C, there in a sense already two methods: (1) Use the method name if it is not overloaded (2) If it is overloaded, mangle the argument types to disambiguate. From that view, I'm merely introducing a second, much more readable, fallback before the final catch-all rule.
